values:
Hello, friends! I know I've been neglectful, and I'm sorry. I've had a large amount of computer trouble and a small amount of time for tending to said issues, let alone update. At any rate, here I am now. (Such as I am.) If it helps, I do come with gifts for you. After a few months of not being able to upload any new music, in the past couple days I've added over 60 tracks including:
brand new stuff from And One, Assemblage23, Beastie Boys, Duran Duran, Icon of Coil, Killers, Morrissey, Real Life, and Seabound classics from The Church, Concrete Blonde, Nick Cave, Depeche Mode, Fad Gadget, Shriekback, The Smiths, This Mortal Coil, Ultravox, and Yaz also plenty of other great songs by artists from Peter Murphy to Dean Martin
I guess you could say I had some fun putting this together. I hope you will enjoy listening. In other news, I am putting the finishing touches on the next Sampler CD. Drop me a line if you want a copy. Cheers! -db Listen Now!

As you may know, I changed the bit-rate to open things up for those who lack broadband.
With that, I have more space to play with, so I have been trying to make some major revisions to the music library.  
This, of course, is an on-going process, so be sure to check in regularly.
Fall is more or less upon us.  With that, I have a new CD compilation if anyone wants a copy.
You know the drill: just say the word and it's on the way...
cheers-
-db

RESURRECTION Saturday, 28 June 2003 (normal club times, you know) The Steeple Lounge in Charlotte (1212 Pecan 704.333.5545)
(flyer)
There's an unexpected addition to this event... I will be DJ'ing downstairs. Many people know that I have an internet radio station, but this whole "doing-it-in-public" thing is new to me. There will be, of course, several great local Goth/Industrial DJ's and I'm honoured to be included. I hope you can all make it out, and while you're there, come visit me in the lounge downstairs. Cheers! -DJ Dresden Black

I finally got new music up on the station. Yesterday, I added music by:
(*: brand new music)
  • A-ha *
  • Alphaville
  • Bjork
  • Cause & Effect)
  • Conjure One
  • Depeche Mode
  • De/Vision
  • Diorama *
  • Duran Duran
  • Electronic
  • Emilie Autumn
  • Erasure *
  • Iris *
  • Kate Bush
  • Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds *
  • Rasputina *
  • Violent Femmes
  • VNV Nation
I've still got more changes on the way soon. I am also starting work on the Spring Sampler 2003 CD, so if you think you might want to be on the list when I mail these out, send me a message. Thanks for listening! -db

As I type this, I am uploading new music to the station.
Just a little bit of Christmas music to get one in the mood, or something like that.
(Needless to say, with a Wintermute twist.)
If anyone has any special holiday requests, please let me know.
as always,
yours-
-db

All the cool kids were doing it, so I did too:
The Advertising Slogan Generator
Wintermute Radio. It's What's For Dinner. Only The Crumbliest Flakiest Wintermute Radio. Pure Wintermute Radio. Just for the Taste of Wintermute Radio. I Can't Believe I Ate The Whole Wintermute Radio. Promise Her Anything, But Give Her Wintermute Radio Nobody Does It Like Wintermute Radio. Poppin' Fresh Wintermute Radio. Make It A Wintermute Radio Night. Welcome To Wintermute Radio Country. Nothing Comes Between Me And My Wintermute Radio. Where's The Wintermute Radio? Wintermute Radio - The Freshmaker! The Curiously Strong Wintermute Radio.. When It Absolutely, Positively Has To Be Wintermute Radio Overnight. Maybe She's Born With It, Maybe It's Wintermute Radio. I Think, Therefore Wintermute Radio. Wintermute Radio is so Bracing. Out Of The Strong Came Forth Wintermute Radio. Please Don't Squeeze The Wintermute Radio. It's Not TV. It's Wintermute Radio. Mmmmmmmmmm-Wintermute Radio. Aaahh, Wintermute Radio! Is It Live, Or Is It Wintermute Radio? You've Got Questions. We've Got Wintermute Radio. Snap! Crackle! Wintermute Radio! Lipsmackin' Thirstquenchin' Acetastin' Motivatin' Goodbuzzin' Cooltalkin' Highwalkin' Fastlivin' Evergivin' Coolfizzin' Wintermute Radio. Because Wintermute Radio is Complicated Enough. Mama Mia, That'sa One Spicy Wintermute Radio! The Loudest Noise Comes From The Electric Wintermute Radio.
Which one's your favorite?

I have just completed a fairly major update! You will now be able to hear:
  • new Assemblage 23
  • new Covenant
  • The KLF
  • classic Depeche Mode
  • some silliness from The Dead Milkmen
  • as well as various other additions
Of course, there is more new stuff coming soon.... I'd also like to thank for bringing Abney Park to my attention. They do good stuff (some of which you may now hear on the station.) As always, I'd love to hear your comments/suggestions/requests. Thanks for listening. yours, -db

eventually, i will post station updates and such here
just not tonight
till...
-db
